Posts.Content: On Feb 13, 2015 4:03 AM Lucy1718 wrote: Yes I have been on Exemestrane 25mg for over a year, it is the second drug as with you. My worst side effect is it truly makes me soooooo tired, and a little achy in the bones. Thank you for your reply.  It is very much appreciated.  I'm also experiencing fatigue.  But the "good" side effect is that I am not as hungry as I was on the Anastrazole.   Thank you again. :-)
Posts.Title: Anyone taking EXEMESTRANE 25 mg?

Posts.Content: I am now reading that these anti-cancer drugs can effect the heart.  Has anyone out there experienced anything having to do with the heart or other organs using Aromasin/Exemestane?
Posts.Title: Aromasin/Exemestane

Posts.Content: I had a systemic rash develop after 5 months on Anastrozole.  So, my doctor is now putting me on EXEMESTRANE 25 mg starting this week after being off of Anastrozole for 2 weeks (rash has cleared up).  Has anyone taken this drug?  What side effects did you have from this drug?  How long have you been on it?
Posts.Title: Anyone taking EXEMESTRANE 25 mg?

Posts.Content: On Feb 26, 2015 4:36 PM GLCAC7485 wrote: Hi EvWallace, I'm glad your rash has cleared up.  I am taking Exemestrane 25 mg.  I was put on in it seven months ago when I had a recurrence.  I had been on Anastrozole for 4 years.  Since it was a local recurrence and no metastasis, the Oncologist said the Anastrozole had helped.  It is difficult for me to decide if the Exemestrane is causing fatigue and or bone pain due to the chemo and radiation side effects.  The Oncologist put me on B12-1mg due to another issue which seems to help with the fatigue.   Hi GLCAC7485,  Thank you for taking the time to respond to my question.  I appreciate it.  So far, I am finding that my side effects from Exemestrane is fatigue and bone pain also.  Sometimes, the bone pain is very severe but it doesn't last long.  The oncologist has me on 1200 mg of calcium and D3 vitamin everyday.  I will try the B12 and see if that helps with the fatigue. I wish you good health.  Thank you again.
Posts.Title: Anyone taking EXEMESTRANE 25 mg?

Posts.Content: On Jun 05, 2014 1:15 PM cancerkeys wrote: Thanks to everyone who has replied. The info is very helpful. I am also battling stopping the arimadex completely. I wish I knew of some people who have done this long term but can't seem to find any info. I changed my diet to veggies, fruit, nuts and will do fresh local fish one day per week. I am stopping all processed foods. It is hard to do! Boy do I crave bread! I am going to try and fight the estrogen naturally. I see there is only a 4% better odds using arimadex. I have been on it one month and haven't been able to get out of bed for a week! My neck hurts so bad and I have a migraine headache from it! I want to do yoga but can't stand up. I am 5'9" and 145 pounds so I don't have much body fat left to create estrogen. I think I need to check that book out :-) Hi, just wanted to let you know that my oncologist put me on a drug called Letrozole after many side effects from Arimidex and Aromasin.  Please contact your doctor and ask him to change your meds if you are having so many adverse side effects.  Good luck and God bless.
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: On Aug 17, 2005 12:00 AM Rossy wrote: I'm new to this site but maybe this will be of interest to someone. I have been on Arimidex for almost 2 years now, having had a mastectomy in November 2003. Firstly I had hardly any side effects and slowly but surely they seem to be building up, some days far worse than the next. I have never had nausea though, thank goodness. The main side effects which I am experiencing now are aching bones and joints, mainly while trying to sleep at night. Also tiredness and seem to want to just go to bed to rest from as early as 8 in the evening - this is sad as I always went to bed late before my breast cancer. I also contemplated coming off the drug but decided that as the cancer hasn't come back at all in almost 2 years then perhaps I am doing the right thing in taking it every day. Hello everyone,  I wanted to let you all know that I was on Arimidex also.  First it was Arimidex...horrible rash developed after 5 months...then it was on to Exemestane (Aromasin)...bone pain, joint pain, hair loss.  But now my oncologist has me on Letrozole 2.5 mg once daily.  Hardly any side effects compared to other two drugs.  Bottom line is, if you are having bad side effects, call your doctor and tell him to change your medication!
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: On May 21, 2016 12:11 AM Ragsmom wrote: this blog has given me much food for thought. I have been on Anastrazole for only 3 1/2 months. My biggest challenges are bone pain, and cramping, which are significantly more challenging at night; and sleeplessness. I also have a low libido and vaginal dryness. Being post menopausal, I had previously had trouble with dryness and lack of sex drive. Now it's much worse. But the bone pain worries me most. I have an elevated blood calcium level, which the doctor is watching, and osteopenia, which I Discovered at the same time as my breast cancer diagnosis. I plan on talking with my doctor, now that I understand there may be other drugs that might not make me feel quite so bad. I also had bone pain on Aromasin.  My oncologist switched me to Letrozole.  No more bone pain.  Only bad side effects are hair loss and slight weight gain.  Ask your doctor to switch you to another medication.  Good luck and God bless.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: On Jan 16, 2015 2:46 PM EvWallace wrote: After being on Anastrazole for 5 months, I developed a severe skin rash.  The rash started on my irradiated breast and was on the inner arms, groin area, behind the knees and around my neck.  I called the radiation oncologist and was referred to my GP.  Went to the GP after 1 week of rash and was told that it was probably due to the Anastrozole (systemic rash).  Called Oncologist and was told to stop taking the Anastrozole for 2 weeks.  I'm now on the 3rd day of not taking the drug and the rash seems to be getting better.  Yep, it's the drug alright! Oh, and yes, the rash was extremely itchy!!  Kept me up all night.  I actually used 100 proof vodka on rash before the doctor prescribed Triamcinolone Acetonide Ointment USP, 0.1%
Posts.Title: Arimidix (anastrozole) skin side effects?

Posts.Content: On Feb 27, 2015 9:01 AM Mich903 wrote: I have been on Arimidex for six years now post stage two invasive carcinoma breast. In the first two years I had four of my fingers operated on due to trigger finger. Hot flushes never stop, drive me crazy! I have had Shingles. In the past three months I have developed a rash on both upper arms. Extremely itchy, wakes me up at night. Swabbed by my GP nil result. It looks purple after the sores clear up. Then it starts again. I am seeing my specialist in two weeks and am going to ask him if I can change my medication. He has told me I have to stay on the Arimidex for another five years. Hello Mich903, I was on Arimidex for only 5 months when I developed a horrible rash.  My oncologist told me to stop taking Arimidex for 3 weeks and then put me on Aromasin/Exemestrane 25 mg.  I also have to take this drug for the next 4 years (total of 5 yrs).  I would ask him/her again to change the drug.  I am told that the systemic rash from these drugs can be dangerous.  Good luck and keep everyone posted.  P.S.  I had the same diagnosis as you.
Posts.Title: Arimidix (anastrozole) skin side effects?

Posts.Content: On Jan 16, 2015 4:20 PM boc0913 wrote: Sorry to hear about your reaction.  Wondering if you could give me some advice.  Found out they want me to take it as well.  Have a very low, low risk, and I'm not sure it is worth the side effects.  I've just recently developed severe allegies to antibiotibics, so reading this really helped.  Wondering what other side effects you've had over 5 months.  I'm just not convinced I should be on it.....so anything you can contribute would be helpful in my decision making.  Any chance for you they would try a different med....something similar?  What happens if you react again?  Hope you feel better soon.  We all have enough to deal with, without reactions like that! I also have a very low risk of cancer returning, however, I have been told numerous times by many different Cooper cancer doctors that it is strongly advised to take one of these drugs for 5 to 10 years due to chance of recurrance.  I've had several side effects so far from Anastrazole.  Started with hot flashes almost right away.  Those lessened after about a month to 6 weeks.  Next came the sleeplessness.  That was pretty bad for a while.  Then came hair loss and now this rash.  They will be putting me on another drug after 2 weeks.  Hope that this helped.
Posts.Title: Arimidix (anastrozole) skin side effects?

Posts.Content: After being on Anastrazole for 5 months, I developed a severe skin rash.  The rash started on my irradiated breast and was on the inner arms, groin area, behind the knees and around my neck.  I called the radiation oncologist and was referred to my GP.  Went to the GP after 1 week of rash and was told that it was probably due to the Anastrozole (systemic rash).  Called Oncologist and was told to stop taking the Anastrozole for 2 weeks.  I'm now on the 3rd day of not taking the drug and the rash seems to be getting better.  Yep, it's the drug alright!
Posts.Title: Arimidix (anastrozole) skin side effects?

Posts.Content: On Jan 22, 2015 2:28 PM Smurfberri wrote: On May 31, 2014 2:46 AM Alberta66 wrote: Has any one had a skin rash since taking arimidex (anastrozole) 1 mg daily e.g. itchy raise patches on abdomen, groin, chest, eyelids, and areas under eyes?  The itching is intense at night.  I have been checked my MD and dermatologist this is not scabies.   Finally had biopsy of one of the patches.  The resuts showed the histopathologic findings are consistent with the clinical impression of a reaction to a medication.  The pathology (lab report) cannot name the drug.  That will take me getting over the terrible skin erruptions and possible trying the Arimidex again.  Was wondering if any one else has had a similiar reaction.I've got the skin rash as well. It started after 2 yrs on Anastrozole and quite itchy at times. It's affecting my groin area, inner thighs, my rectal area, under my breasts and incredibly my inner jaw area. The doctors are denying a possible side effect to the med. I've had a biopsy and was assured it was not cancerous but no one seems to know what to do with it. Hoping to get a resolution soon . 2 years after starting Anastrozole!  Mine started after only 5 months.  Mine started on the irradiated breast and spread from there to every part of my body except face, head and lower legs.  My Cooper doctors immediately removed me from taking the drug therefore, I can assume that they think that this was a systemic reaction to the drug. Still itching after 3 weeks.   Hope that you get a resolution to your problem soon and good luck.
Posts.Title: Arimidix (anastrozole) skin side effects?

Posts.Content: On Jan 22, 2015 3:40 PM boc0913 wrote: Sorry to hear about your reaction too.  With so many responding, its seem the drug manufacture would have more info on this.  What an either or situation this is?  So many challenges and then making the decision on whether to take something with so many side effects for such a long time. Thank you all for your input.  It really helps, as I do have a decision to make.  I truly hope they can find a resolution. I've suddenly had severe allergic reaction to antibiotics.  It started when I had an extreme case of cellulitis in my breast in Oct, which ultimately led to my diagnosis.  After mastectomy and reconstruction, they tried a different med, and about a week later another reaction.  So, I can sympathize with the skin rashes and itches.  I hope they can find a compromise for you.  Maybe a different, similar drug.  I'm sorry to hear about your drug reaction.  I contacted my doctor and was told that the reason for taking the anti-cancer drug is reasonable because I tested as node positive.  Meaning that a cancer cell was found in the sentinel node.  The doctor has now placed me on a drug similar in nature to Anastrozole but hopefully with less side effects.  Sit down with your doctor and have a list of questions for him.  Pros and cons about your situation.  Then make the decision that is right for you.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: Arimidix (anastrozole) skin side effects?

Posts.Content: Hi, I've had a lumpectomy and radiation.  My sister is a nurse and she went out and bought me a front closing soft sports-type bra.  It was very comfortable.  Any sports type bra (no underwires!!) will do nicely.  I wish you the best.
Posts.Title: Bra suggestions following lumpectomy

Posts.Content: On Jan 10, 2009 12:00 AM Terriet wrote: I am trying to get prepared for lumpectomy and radiation.  I currently wear a back closing underwire bra.  I dont' think that will be comfortable following the lumpectomy.  Does anyone have suggestions of a specific bra that worked well following lumpectomy?  Any other suggestions for things I will need during recovering and an idea on how long it takes to recover?  Trying to get an idea of how many days I can anticipate to take off work.  I'm sure alot of this depends on the extensiveness of the surgery and the individual.  But I would appreciate any suggestions.  Hi Terriet.  I had a lumpectomy done and radiation.  After the lumpectomy I found that a front closing bra was the best.  I found it at Sears and it is all cotton with no underwire.  As for a bra after radiation, try not to wear one as much as you can in order for the skin to stay less irritated.  However, if you must wear a bra, the front closure bra was my "go to" also. Good luck and good health to you.
Posts.Title: Bra suggestions following lumpectomy

Posts.Content: On May 20, 2015 1:21 PM annboeglin wrote: On May 14, 2015 9:16 PM Brumie wrote: My name is Karen and am 48 yrs old. I was diagnosed with breast cancer stage 1, grade 2 in January 2015. Had a left mastectomy in April 2015 with reconstruction on right Breast I was told I could not have radiation due to my autoimmune disease, Lupus, which I have had for over 25 yrs. so I get inflammation of joints, aches and pains, had to have knees replaced in 2012 Cuz I was bone on bone. Had a work injury in 2009 with my back. 2 compression fractures and 2 herniated discs with degenerative joint disease. With all of my health issues already, they want me to take arimidex. And by what I have read, it sounds like I don't want to take it.. I don't want my already health issues to get even worse by this medicine or anything else for that matter. What do I do? Any suggestions? I am Ann and 66yrs of age. I am recovering from triple heart bypass surgery with complications. I have been taking an Arimidex med since Feb 2011. I had a mastectomy of my left breast and reconstruction, no radiation or chemo. Genetically there is no heart disease in my family. I do not smoke, never did. Healthy life style, ideal weight, very active does not fit the profile for my heart problem. I t would be almost impossible to convince me that this arimidex drug did not cause the trauma I have been through. I am blessed that the mild heart attack did not take my life. Oh my Ann.  I'm sorry to hear about your mild heart attack.  I was on Arimidex also for 5 months after which I came down with a horrible systemic rash caused by this med.  My oncologist switched me over to Aromasin/Exemestane 25 mg.  I'm now wondering if this drug will have any lasting side effects and affect my heart or other organs.  I'm tired and have rapid weight gain from this drug.  My GP tells me to stay on the drug because I chose a lumpectomy and radiation rather than mastectomy.  I am 64 years old and had breast cancer last year.  Good luck to you.
Posts.Title: To take arimidex or not?

Posts.Content: On Jan 14, 2016 2:30 PM MsTabbyKats wrote: Long story short....doctor wants me on arimidex.  Medically speaking, I am inclined to agree. However...statistically it improves my life expectancy by 6 months and reduces the chance of recurrance from 18% to 10%. Side effects of arimidex are significantly higher. I'm into quality of life...not quantity.  And it seems everyone has some side effect. Is there anyone who just takes the pill....without side effects? Hi MsTabbyKats.  Just wanted to share with you.  I was on Anastrozole first which caused a 3 week skin rash.  Watch out for this side effect...doctor will take you off the drug immediately.  Next, I was prescribed Aromasin (Exemestane).  That drug caused me to have bone pain and hair loss.  Oncologist then put me on Letrozole.  This drug has less side effects (although I am experiencing weight gain) and I am tolerating it well.  Talk with your oncologist and report your side effects.   As for your quality, not quantity remark, I have a friend with melanoma who said the same thing.  I told him that if the cancer comes back, he will not have quality or quantity.  I wish you the best.
Posts.Title: Anyone with no Arimidex Side Effects?
